Account Tags

Account tags are a concept specific to MetalAccounting. Account tags are important for assembling financial reports based on specific types of accounts.

Cash Tag

The cash tag can be assigned to a current non-contra asset account representing cash or cash equivalents. This tag is required for generating the cash flow worksheet and statement of cash flows. All journal entries that involve an account tagged as cash will appear on the cash flow worksheet for that period.

Retained Earnings Tag

The retained earnings tag can be assigned to a non-contra equity account representing retained earnings. This tag is required for generating the statement of retained earnings.

Cost of Goods Sold Tag

The cost of goods sold tag can be assigned to a non-contra operating expense account, or a contra operating revenue account. This tag is optionally used when generating the income statement. If 1 or more accounts are assigned the cost of goods sold tag, the income statement will show gross profit separatly from operating income.
